title: Supply Chain Vulnerabilities
description: Supply chain vulnerabilities occur when third-party models, datasets, plugins, or dependencies contain security flaws. This includes compromised pre-trained models, malicious plugins, vulnerable dependencies, or untrusted third-party services integrated into the LLM system.
detection_patterns: Third-party APIs integrated without security assessment
attack_vectors: Supply chain attacks on model repositories

mitigations.implementation: Implement dependency scanning, verify model checksums, review plugin code, and maintain a software bill of materials (SBOM).
Use signed models, verify checksums, maintain model registry with provenance tracking, and use trusted model sources.
Sandbox plugins, implement least privilege, review plugin code, and use allowlists for approved plugins.
Use automated tools to scan dependencies for known vulnerabilities and keep dependencies updated.

references.title: OWASP LLM Top 10 - LLM05: Supply Chain Vulnerabilities
